result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin Jackson

defendant.name: Jackson, Melvin
defendant.address: 5700 West Wahner Avenue #103, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: Appointing Attorney at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Melvin Jackson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent. Court appoints Joe Domask as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Joe Domask accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing December 1st, 2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melvin Jackson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Melvin Jackson
Current: 5700 West Wahner Avenue #103, Brown Deer, WI 53223   (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 5700 West Wahner Avenue #115, Brown Deer, WI 53223
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/26/22 @ 2p
